description: optimization run unique ID
job ID of the optimization run
mod department number
mod category number
mod category description
fineline name
brand name
vendor name
planogram/ store unique ID
roll-up grouping (a physical display case, e.g., shelf, etc.)
roll-up/ item unique ID
roll-up/ item name/ description
recommendation - can be 'add', 'delete', 'maintain' or 'not added'

Recommendation reason code. Valid codes are: 'Intuitive', 'Width not sufficient to adhere utilization', 'Protect List', 'Space available for additional productive items', 'Global Deletes', 'No better item to add / expand', 'Item cannot fit on the shelf', 'Covers a need state', 'Do Not Carry List', 'Not productive when required to meet PnH', 'DoS / PnH Violation', 'Better substitute Recommended', 'More productive items recommended', 'No better item to add / expand', 'Other', '1. Others - Contribution % lies > 95% (low performing item)', '2. Others'
Recommendation reason category. Valid categories are: 'Intuitive', 'Soft Constraint Penalty', 'Force Protect', 'Space Availability', 'Better Recommendation', 'Force Delete', 'Other'
reasons/ explanation for an 'add' or 'delete' recommendation, i.e., why an item is added or deleted
higher performing substitute name/ description, if any
recommended number of facings
number of facings in the current mod
reasons/ explanation for a facings change, i.e., expansion or contraction
facing width in inches
total shelf width in inches
calculated DoS at recommended facings
DoS calculated at current/ historical facings
Recommended units
Recommended sales
Recommended profits
Base forecast profit for current mod items
Base forecast sales for current mod items
Base forecast units for current mod items
facings on historical mod
stock quantity at one facing
mod length in weeks
linear nominal demand at maximum facing
linear nominal demand at minimum facing
Demand (units) by width at minimum facings. Also called productivity.
normalized demand
For current mod PoDs, contribution to total normalized_demand. Calculated as cumulative sum of normalized_demand (in descending order) / total normalized_demand . Lower is better.
for current mod PoDs, contribution to total units per store per week forecast.
contribution to total normalized demand
contribution to total units per store per week forecast
rank based on nominal_demand_per_inch at national level (considering the sum of nominal demand per inch for the item across all stores)
rank based on nominal_demand_per_inch at national level (considering the average nominal demand per inch for the item across all stores)
rank by productivity expressed as a fraction
rank in the store based on the productivity percentile
rank across all the stores at the national level based on its units sold per store per week (forecast)
rank across all the stores at the national level based on its units sold per store per week (actuals)
rank in the store based on total units
fractional demand transferred to substitutes in case of a 'delete' recommendation
demand times demand-transferred-to-substitutes
indicator of a global constraint
indicator of a global constraint
indicator of a protect strategy
indicator if the recommendation is intuitive based on total_comp_shelf_width and productivity_percentile_rank
indicator of a DoS constraint violation
indicator if a subtitute is available

PoD maxed out on facings because:
1. recommended facings reached a cut off point (no more incrementality at higher facings) or,
2. adding more facings incurs more DoS penalty or,
3. adding more facings exceeds total shelf width or,
4. if status is 'not added' then any number of facings incur either PnH or DoS penalty or,
4. it is a force delete
